data.message: Getting messages from a man claiming to be program coordinator for Facebook. I know this a hoax and someone trying to scam us. His name is Tommy Reid Brown. I would imagine Facebook might want to eliminate this person before he/she ends up scamming people. Pretty sad

replies.message: Hey Rachael. You're right, this sounds like a spam message. Please report this message as spam by going to the conversation, opening the Actions menu and selecting 'Report as Spam or Abuse'. Thanks for taking the time to keep Facebook a safe and welcoming environment. -Nancy
Here is another account doing the same thing
Lol that account picture is probably from like the third page first result in google images

I reported Tommy Reid Brown and I got a reply saying that his account didn't violate community standards or something like that. It's clearly someone representing to be from Facebook and yet your reporting feature fails.

Cody,  I have sent about 40 reports of someone's account being hacked and that is the reply I keep getting back.  The fact is Facebook does not have anyone actually checking these reports they are just sending generic  replies.
